## 1. Standard Content Layout

This is the **Default Layout** for general content.

- **Typography**: Clean sans-serif font (Source Sans Pro).
- **Contrast**: Text color auto-adapts to your `theme-bg-color`.
- **Aspect Ratio**: 16:9 Widescreen standard.

### Sub-header Example
You can use standard Markdown sub-headers to organize text.

> **Blockquotes** look crisp and professional in this theme.

---

## 2. Callout Boxes (Styled)

We manually enabled `tcolorbox` support to make these work.

::: {.callout-note}
**Note Box:** Use this for neutral information or side notes.
:::

::: {.callout-tip}
**Tip Box:** Perfect for highlighting best practices or "pro tips."
:::

::: {.callout-warning}
**Warning Box:** Use for potential pitfalls or data limitations.
:::

::: {.callout-important}
**Important Box:** Critical takeaways or "bottom line" statements.
:::

---

## 3. Math Layout (Vertical Centering)

Use the `layout-math` environment to center complex equations.

```{=latex}
\begin{layout-math}
```
$$
\text{LogLikelihood}(\theta) = \sum_{i=1}^{N} \ln P(d_i | x_i, \theta)
$$

$$
\hat{P}_{it} = \beta_0 + \beta_1 \text{Risk}_{it} + \beta_2 \text{Subsidy}_{it} + \epsilon_{it}
$$

*Equations serve as the visual focal point of the slide.*
```{=latex}
\end{layout-math}
```

## 8. Theme Reference Gallery

The following slides demonstrate how to override the global color scheme.

---

## 
\LightMode
### Reference: Light Mode

This layout forces a **White Background** and **Black Text**.

- Safe for printing handouts.
- Overrides the global dark theme.
- **Usage:** Put `\LightMode` at the top of the slide.

---

## 
\BlackMode
### Reference: OLED Black

This layout forces a **Pure Black Background**.

- High contrast.
- Great for OLED screens.
- **Usage:** Put `\BlackMode` at the top of the slide.

---

## 
\BrandMode
### Reference: Brand Color

This layout uses your brand hex code (e.g., #7D181E).

- Good for section dividers.
- **Usage:** Put `\BrandMode` at the top of the slide.

---

## 
\BerkeleyMode
### Reference: Berkeley Matte (Modern)

This layout uses the **Modern Matte** aesthetic (Softened Dark Mode).

- **Background**: Matte Blue (`#0D2D52`) reduces eye strain compared to the official high-contrast blue.
- **Accent**: Gold is used only for bullets and thin strips.
- **Usage**: `\BerkeleyMode` at the start of the slide.

---

## 
\BerkeleyLightMode
### Reference: Berkeley Academic (Light)

This layout is optimized for **Data-Heavy Presentations**.

- **Background**: Pure White (preserves integrity of imported R/Python plots).
- **Header**: Official Blue bar with Gold accent line.
- **Usage**: `\BerkeleyLightMode` at the start of the slide.

::: {.callout-tip}
**Plotting Advice:**
Use this layout when your slide contains complex charts with white backgrounds. It eliminates the "white box on dark slide" amateur look.
:::
